Badge.name: Badge

descriptions.primary: Default high-emphasis badge for important labels

examples: Primary Secondary Destructive Outline Beta
<Badge variant="primary">Primary</Badge>
<Badge variant="secondary">Secondary</Badge>
<Badge variant="destructive">Destructive</Badge>
<Badge variant="outline">Outline</Badge>
<Badge variant="beta">Beta</Badge>
Workers Beta
Badge.baseStyles: inline-flex w-fit flex-none shrink-0 items-center justify-self-start rounded-full px-2 py-0.5 text-xs font-medium whitespace-nowrap

Banner.name: Banner
examples: This is an informational banner. This is an alert banner. This is an error banner.
<Banner>This is an informational banner.</Banner>
<Banner variant="alert">Your session will expire soon.</Banner>
<Banner variant="error">We couldn't save your changes.</Banner>

<Banner icon={<WarningCircle />} variant="alert">
      Review your billing information.
    </Banner>
}> This banner supports custom content with Text.
Banner.baseStyles: flex w-full items-center gap-2 rounded-lg border px-4 py-1.5 text-base

Breadcrumbs.name: Breadcrumbs
examples:
<Breadcrumbs>
      <Breadcrumbs.Link href="#">Home</Breadcrumbs.Link>
      <Breadcrumbs.Separator />
      <Breadcrumbs.Link href="#">Docs</Breadcrumbs.Link>
      <Breadcrumbs.Separator />
      <Breadcrumbs.Current>Breadcrumbs</Breadcrumbs.Current>
    </Breadcrumbs>

<Breadcrumbs>
      <Breadcrumbs.Link href="#" icon={<House size={16} />}>
        Home
      </Breadcrumbs.Link>
      <Breadcrumbs.Separator />
      <Breadcrumbs.Link href="#">Projects</Breadcrumbs.Link>
      <Breadcrumbs.Separator />
      <Breadcrumbs.Current>Current Project</Breadcrumbs.Current>
    </Breadcrumbs>

<Breadcrumbs>
      <Breadcrumbs.Link href="#" icon={<House size={16} />}>
        Home
      </Breadcrumbs.Link>
      <Breadcrumbs.Separator />
      <Breadcrumbs.Link href="#">Docs</Breadcrumbs.Link>
      <Breadcrumbs.Separator />
      <Breadcrumbs.Current loading></Breadcrumbs.Current>
    </Breadcrumbs>

<Breadcrumbs>
      <Breadcrumbs.Current icon={<House size={16} />}>
        Worker Analytics
      </Breadcrumbs.Current>
    </Breadcrumbs>

<Breadcrumbs>
      <Breadcrumbs.Link href="#">Home</Breadcrumbs.Link>
      <Breadcrumbs.Separator />
      <Breadcrumbs.Current>Breadcrumbs</Breadcrumbs.Current>
      <Breadcrumbs.Clipboard text="#" />
    </Breadcrumbs>

Button.name: Button

descriptions.xs: Extra small button for compact UIs

descriptions.secondary: Default button style for most actions
descriptions.destructive: Danger button for destructive actions like delete
descriptions.secondary-destructive: Secondary button with destructive text for less prominent dangerous actions

examples: <Button variant="primary">Primary</Button>
<Button variant="secondary">Secondary</Button>
<Button variant="ghost">Ghost</Button>
<Button variant="destructive">Destructive</Button>
<Button variant="outline">Outline</Button>
<Button variant="secondary-destructive">Secondary Destructive</Button>

<Button variant="secondary" icon={PlusIcon}>
      Create Worker
    </Button>

<Button variant="primary" loading>
      Loading...
    </Button>

<Button variant="secondary" disabled>
      Disabled
    </Button>

Checkbox.name: Checkbox

variant.description: Visual variant: "default" or "error" for validation failures (visual only, no error text)

label.description: Label content for the checkbox (enables built-in Field wrapper) - can be a string or any React node

labelTooltip.description: Tooltip content to display next to the label via an info icon

controlFirst.description: When true (default), checkbox appears before label. When false, label appears before checkbox.

indeterminate.description: Whether the checkbox is in indeterminate state

examples:
<Checkbox
      label="Accept terms and conditions"
      checked={checked}
      onCheckedChange={setChecked}
    />

<Checkbox
      label="Enable notifications"
      checked={checked}
      onCheckedChange={setChecked}
    />
<Checkbox label="I agree" checked={checked} onCheckedChange={setChecked} />

<Checkbox
      label="Select all"
      indeterminate={indeterminate}
      onCheckedChange={setIndeterminate}
    />

<Checkbox
      label="Remember me"
      controlFirst={false}
      checked={checked}
      onCheckedChange={setChecked}
    />
<Checkbox label="Disabled option" disabled />
<Checkbox label="Invalid option" variant="error" />

<Checkbox.Group
      legend="Email preferences"
      description="Choose how you'd like to receive updates"
      value={preferences}
      onValueChange={setPreferences}
    >
      <Checkbox.Item value="email" label="Email notifications" />
      <Checkbox.Item value="sms" label="SMS notifications" />
      <Checkbox.Item value="push" label="Push notifications" />
    </Checkbox.Group>

<Checkbox.Group
      legend="Required preferences"
      error="Please select at least one notification method"
      value={[]}
      onValueChange={() => {}}
    >
      <Checkbox.Item value="email" label="Email" variant="error" />
      <Checkbox.Item value="sms" label="SMS" variant="error" />
    </Checkbox.Group>

ClipboardText.name: ClipboardText

descriptions.sm: Small clipboard text for compact UIs
descriptions.lg: Large clipboard text for prominent display

text.description: The text to display and copy to clipboard

examples: <ClipboardText text="0c239dd2" />
<ClipboardText text="abc123" />
<ClipboardText text="sk_live_51H8..." />
<ClipboardText text="https://example.com/very/long/url/path" />

Code.name: Code
examples:
<CodeBlock
      lang="tsx"
      code={`const greeting = "Hello, World!";
console.log(greeting);`}
    />

<CodeBlock
      lang="tsx"
      code={`interface User {
  id: string;
  name: string;
  email: string;
}

const user: User = {
  id: "1",
  name: "John Doe",
  email: "john@example.com"
};`}
    />

<CodeBlock
      lang="bash"
      code={`npm install @cloudflare/kumo
pnpm add @cloudflare/kumo`}
    />

<CodeBlock
      lang="jsonc"
      code={`{
  "name": "kumo",
  "version": "1.0.0",
  "dependencies": {
    "react": "^19.0.0"
  }
}`}
    />

<Code
      lang="bash"
      code="export API_KEY={{apiKey}}"
      values={{
        apiKey: { value: "sk_live_123", highlight: true },
      }}
    />

Collapsible.name: Collapsible
Collapsible.description: Collapsible component for showing/hiding content.  Features: - Animated chevron indicator (rotates 180° when open) - Accessible with aria-expanded and aria-controls - Content panel with left border accent

label.description: Text label displayed in the trigger button

open.description: Whether the collapsible content is visible

className.description: Additional CSS classes for the content panel

examples: Kumo is Cloudflare's new design system.
Kumo is Cloudflare's new design system.
Kumo is Cloudflare's new design system. Install the components and import them into your project. Check the repository for license information.

Combobox.name: Combobox

descriptions.right: Input positioned inline to the right of chips

items.description: Array of items to display in the dropdown

label.description: Label content for the combobox (enables Field wrapper) - can be a string or any React node

labelTooltip.description: Tooltip content to display next to the label via an info icon

description.description: Helper text displayed below the combobox

error.description: Error message or validation error object

isItemEqualToValue.description: Custom equality function for comparing items

examples:
<Combobox
      value={value}
      onValueChange={(v) => setValue(v as string | null)}
      items={fruits}
    >
      <Combobox.TriggerInput placeholder="Please select" />
      <Combobox.Content>
        <Combobox.Empty />
        <Combobox.List>
          {(item: string) => (
            <Combobox.Item key={item} value={item}>
              {item}
            </Combobox.Item>
          )}
        </Combobox.List>
      </Combobox.Content>
    </Combobox>

<Combobox
      value={value}
      onValueChange={(v) => setValue(v as Language)}
      items={languages}
    >
      <Combobox.TriggerValue className="w-[200px]" />
      <Combobox.Content>
        <Combobox.Input placeholder="Search languages" />
        <Combobox.Empty />
        <Combobox.List>
          {(item: Language) => (
            <Combobox.Item key={item.value} value={item}>
              {item.emoji} {item.label}
            </Combobox.Item>
          )}
        </Combobox.List>
      </Combobox.Content>
    </Combobox>

<Combobox
      value={value}
      onValueChange={(v) => setValue(v as ServerLocation | null)}
      items={servers}
    >
      <Combobox.TriggerInput
        className="w-[200px]"
        placeholder="Select server"
      />
      <Combobox.Content>
        <Combobox.Empty />
        <Combobox.List>
          {(group: ServerLocationGroup) => (
            <Combobox.Group key={group.value} items={group.items}>
              <Combobox.GroupLabel>{group.value}</Combobox.GroupLabel>
              <Combobox.Collection>
                {(item: ServerLocation) => (
                  <Combobox.Item key={item.value} value={item}>
                    {item.label}
                  </Combobox.Item>
                )}
              </Combobox.Collection>
            </Combobox.Group>
          )}
        </Combobox.List>
      </Combobox.Content>
    </Combobox>

bot.value === selected.value } multiple > ( {selected.label} )} inputSide="right" /> {(item: BotItem) => (
{item.label} {item.author}
)}
{(item: DatabaseItem) => ( {item.label} )}
{(item: DatabaseItem) => ( {item.label} )}

Collection.description: Renders filtered list items. Use when you need more control over item rendering.

children.description: Function that receives each filtered item and returns a node

Root.name: Root
Root.description: Controls the open state of the dialog. Doesn't render its own HTML element.

open.description: Whether the dialog is currently open (controlled mode)

defaultOpen.description: Whether the dialog is initially open (uncontrolled mode)

onOpenChange.description: Callback fired when the dialog opens or closes

modal.description: Whether the dialog is modal. When true, focus is trapped and page scroll is locked

dismissible.description: Whether clicking outside closes the dialog

Trigger.name: Trigger
Trigger.description: A button that opens the dialog when clicked.

render.description: Custom element to render instead of the default button

Title.name: Title
Title.description: A heading that labels the dialog for accessibility.

render.description: Custom element to render instead of the default h2

Description.name: Description
Description.description: A paragraph providing additional context about the dialog.

render.description: Custom element to render instead of the default p

usageExamples: <Dialog.Description>Are you sure you want to proceed?</Dialog.Description>

Close.name: Close
Close.description: A button that closes the dialog when clicked.

render.description: Custom element to render instead of the default button

disabled.description: Whether the close button is disabled

Empty.name: Empty

descriptions.sm: Compact empty state for smaller containers
descriptions.lg: Large empty state for prominent placement

examples:

controlFirst.description: When true, places the control (checkbox/switch) before the label visually. When false (default), places the label before the control. Used to support different layout patterns (e.g., iOS-style toggles on the right).

label.description: The label content - can be a string or any React node

required.description: When explicitly false, shows gray "(optional)" text after the label. When true or undefined, no indicator is shown.

labelTooltip.description: Tooltip content to display next to the label via an info icon

Grid.name: Grid

children.description: Child node(s) that can be nested inside component

className.description: CSS class names that can be appended to the component

mobileDivider.description: Show dividers between grid items on mobile (only works with 4up variant)

descriptions.base: Default responsive gap between grid items

variant.description: Stylistic variations of the Grid layout

descriptions.2up: Grid items stack on small screens, display side-by-side on medium screens and up
descriptions.2-1: Two-thirds / one-third split (66%/33%) on medium screens and up
descriptions.1-2: One-third / two-thirds split (33%/66%) on medium screens and up
descriptions.1-3up: Grid items stack on small screens, expand to 3 across on large screens
descriptions.3up: Grid items stack on small screens, 2 across on medium, 3 across on large
descriptions.4up: Grid items stack on small screens, progressively increase columns at larger breakpoints
descriptions.6up: Grid items start at 2 across, expand to 6 across on XL
descriptions.1-2-4up: Grid items stack on small screens, 2 across on medium, 4 across on large

Input.name: Input

label.description: Label content for the input (enables Field wrapper) - can be a string or any React node

labelTooltip.description: Tooltip content to display next to the label via an info icon

description.description: Helper text displayed below the input

error.description: Error message or validation error object

descriptions.xs: Extra small input for compact UIs

examples:
<Input
      label="Email"
      placeholder="you@example.com"
      description="We'll never share your email"
    />

<Input
      label="Username"
      placeholder="Choose a username"
      description="3-20 characters, alphanumeric only"
    />

<Input
      label="Email"
      placeholder="you@example.com"
      value="invalid-email"
      variant="error"
      error="Please enter a valid email address"
    />

<Input
      label="Password"
      type="password"
      value="short"
      variant="error"
      error={{
        message: "Password must be at least 8 characters",
        match: "tooShort",
      }}
      minLength={8}
    />
<Input label="Disabled field" placeholder="Cannot edit" disabled />
<Input placeholder="Search..." aria-label="Search products" />

<Input
      label="Phone Number"
      required={false}
      placeholder="+1 (555) 000-0000"
    />

<Input
      label="API Key"
      labelTooltip="Find this in your dashboard under Settings > API Keys"
      placeholder="sk_live_..."
    />
Email for billing } required placeholder="billing@company.com" type="email" />

Label.name: Label
Label.description: Label component for form fields.  Provides a standardized way to display labels with optional indicators: - Optional indicator: gray "(optional)" text when `showOptional={true}` - Tooltip: info icon with hover tooltip for additional context

children.description: The label content - can be a string or any React node

showOptional.description: When true (and required is false), shows gray "(optional)" text after the label

tooltip.description: Tooltip content to display next to the label via an info icon

asContent.description: When true, only renders the inline content (indicators, tooltip) without the outer span with font styling. Useful when composed inside another label element that already provides the text styling.

examples: <Input label="Phone Number" required={false} placeholder="+1 555-0000" />

<Input
      label="API Key"
      labelTooltip="Find this in your dashboard settings under API > Keys"
      placeholder="sk_live_..."
    />
I agree to the Terms of Service } />

examples:

Link.name: Link

descriptions.inline: Inline text link that flows with content
descriptions.current: Link that inherits color from parent text

classes.inline: text-primary underline underline-offset-[0.15em] decoration-[0.0625em] link-current transition-colors
classes.current: text-current underline underline-offset-[0.15em] decoration-[0.0625em] link-current transition-colors

render.description:
Allows you to replace the component’s HTML element with a different tag, or compose it with another component.

Accepts a `ReactElement` or a function that returns the element to render.

examples: Default inline link Current color link Plain inline link
This is a paragraph with an inline link that flows naturally with the surrounding text. Links maintain proper underline offset for readability.

<Link
      href="https://cloudflare.com"
      target="_blank"
      rel="noopener noreferrer"
      className="text-base"
    >
      Visit Cloudflare <Link.ExternalIcon />
    </Link>

      indicatorClassName="from-green-500 via-green-500 to-green-500"

Pagination.name: Pagination

descriptions.full: Full pagination controls with first, previous, page input, next, and last buttons
descriptions.simple: Simple pagination controls with only previous and next buttons

examples: <Pagination page={page} setPage={setPage} perPage={10} totalCount={100} />

<Pagination
      page={page}
      setPage={setPage}
      perPage={10}
      totalCount={100}
      controls="simple"
    />

<Pagination
      page={page}
      setPage={setPage}
      perPage={10}
      totalCount={100}
      controls="full"
    />
<Pagination page={page} setPage={setPage} perPage={10} totalCount={100} />
<Pagination page={page} setPage={setPage} perPage={25} totalCount={1250} />

Popover.name: Popover
Popover.description: Popover component for displaying accessible popup content anchored to a trigger.

descriptions.left: Popover appears to the left of the trigger
descriptions.right: Popover appears to the right of the trigger

examples:
<Popover>
      <Popover.Trigger asChild>
        <Button shape="square" icon={BellIcon} />
      </Popover.Trigger>
      <Popover.Content>
        <Popover.Title>Notifications</Popover.Title>
        <Popover.Description>
          You are all caught up. Good job!
        </Popover.Description>
      </Popover.Content>
    </Popover>

<Popover>
      <Popover.Trigger asChild>
        <Button>Open Popover</Button>
      </Popover.Trigger>
      <Popover.Content>
        <Popover.Title>Popover Title</Popover.Title>
        <Popover.Description>
          This is a basic popover with a title and description.
        </Popover.Description>
      </Popover.Content>
    </Popover>
Settings Configure your preferences below.
Bottom Popover on bottom (default). Top Popover on top. Left Popover on left. Right Popover on right.

Jane Doe

jane@example.com
Hover Triggered This popover opens on hover with a 200ms delay. It can still contain interactive content like buttons and links.

Radio.name: Radio

legend.description: Legend text for the group (required for accessibility)

orientation.description: Layout direction of the radio items

value.description: Value of the radio that should be selected (controlled)

disabled.description: Whether all radios in the group are disabled

controlPosition.description: Position of radio control relative to label: "start" (default) puts radio before label, "end" puts label before radio

name.description: Form submission name for the radio group

examples:
<Radio.Group
      legend="Notification preference"
      value={value}
      onValueChange={setValue}
    >
      <Radio.Item label="Email" value="email" />
      <Radio.Item label="SMS" value="sms" />
      <Radio.Item label="Push notification" value="push" />
    </Radio.Group>

<Radio.Group legend="Account type" value={value} onValueChange={setValue}>
      <Radio.Item label="Personal" value="personal" />
      <Radio.Item label="Business" value="business" />
      <Radio.Item label="Enterprise" value="enterprise" />
    </Radio.Group>

<Radio.Group
      legend="Size"
      orientation="horizontal"
      value={value}
      onValueChange={setValue}
    >
      <Radio.Item label="Small" value="sm" />
      <Radio.Item label="Medium" value="md" />
      <Radio.Item label="Large" value="lg" />
    </Radio.Group>

<Radio.Group
      legend="Shipping method"
      description="Choose how you'd like to receive your order"
      value={value}
      onValueChange={setValue}
    >
      <Radio.Item label="Standard (5-7 days)" value="standard" />
      <Radio.Item label="Express (2-3 days)" value="express" />
      <Radio.Item label="Overnight" value="overnight" />
    </Radio.Group>

<Radio.Group
      legend="Payment method"
      error="Please select a payment method to continue"
    >
      <Radio.Item label="Credit Card" value="card" variant="error" />
      <Radio.Item label="PayPal" value="paypal" variant="error" />
      <Radio.Item label="Bank Transfer" value="bank" variant="error" />
    </Radio.Group>

<Radio.Group legend="Preferences" controlPosition="end" defaultValue="a">
      <Radio.Item label="Label before radio" value="a" />
      <Radio.Item label="Another option" value="b" />
    </Radio.Group>

Select.name: Select

label.description: Label content for the select (enables Field wrapper) - can be a string or any React node

hideLabel.description: Whether to visually hide the label (still accessible to screen readers)

placeholder.description: Placeholder text when no value is selected

loading.description: Whether the select is in a loading state

labelTooltip.description: Tooltip content to display next to the label via an info icon

description.description: Helper text displayed below the select

error.description: Error message or validation error object

examples:
<Select
      className="w-[200px]"
      value={value}
      onValueChange={(v) => setValue(v ?? "apple")}
      items={{ apple: "Apple", banana: "Banana", cherry: "Cherry" }}
    >
      <Select.Option value="apple">Apple</Select.Option>
      <Select.Option value="banana">Banana</Select.Option>
      <Select.Option value="cherry">Cherry</Select.Option>
    </Select>

<Select
      className="w-[200px]"
      value={value}
      onValueChange={(v) => setValue(v as string)}
      items={{
        bug: "Bug",
        documentation: "Documentation",
        feature: "Feature",
      }}
    >
      <Select.Option value="bug">Bug</Select.Option>
      <Select.Option value="documentation">Documentation</Select.Option>
      <Select.Option value="feature">Feature</Select.Option>
    </Select>

<Select
      className="w-[200px]"
      value={value}
      onValueChange={(v) => setValue(v as string | null)}
      items={[
        { value: null, label: "Please select" },
        { value: "bug", label: "Bug" },
        { value: "documentation", label: "Documentation" },
        { value: "feature", label: "Feature" },
      ]}
    >
      <Select.Option value="bug">Bug</Select.Option>
      <Select.Option value="documentation">Documentation</Select.Option>
      <Select.Option value="feature">Feature</Select.Option>
    </Select>
<Select className="w-[200px]" loading />

<Select
      className="w-[200px]"
      loading={loading}
      value={value}
      onValueChange={(v) => setValue(v as string | null)}
      placeholder="Please select"
    >
      {data?.map((item) => (
        <Select.Option key={item} value={item}>
          {item}
        </Select.Option>
      ))}
    </Select>

SensitiveInput.name: SensitiveInput

label.description: Label content for the input (enables Field wrapper and sets masked state label) - can be a string or any React node

labelTooltip.description: Tooltip content to display next to the label via an info icon

description.description: Helper text displayed below the input

error.description: Error message or validation error object

examples:
{sizes.map((size) => (
{size}
))}
Current value: {value}

Surface.name: Surface

as.description: The element type to render as (default: "div")

examples:
Surface Component
A container with consistent elevation and border styling.
As section element As article element As aside element

<Surface className="rounded-lg p-6">
      <Text bold>Outer Surface</Text>
      <Surface className="mt-4 rounded-md bg-kumo-elevated p-4">
        <Text variant="secondary">Nested Surface</Text>
      </Surface>
    </Surface>

Switch.name: Switch

variant.description: Visual variant: "default" or "error" for validation failures (visual only, no error text)

label.description: Label content for the switch (Field wrapper is built-in) - can be a string or any React node. Optional when used standalone for visual-only purposes.

labelTooltip.description: Tooltip content to display next to the label via an info icon

required.description: Whether the switch is required. When explicitly false, shows "(optional)" text after the label.

controlFirst.description: When true (default), switch appears before label. When false, label appears before switch.

examples: <Switch label="Switch" checked={checked} onCheckedChange={setChecked} />
<Switch label="Switch" checked={false} onCheckedChange={() => {}} />
<Switch label="Switch" checked={true} onCheckedChange={() => {}} />
<Switch label="Disabled" checked={false} disabled />

Table.name: Table

descriptions.auto: Auto table layout - columns resize based on content
descriptions.fixed: Fixed table layout - columns have equal width, controlled via colgroup

examples: Subject From Date {emailData.slice(0, 3).map((row) => ( {row.subject} {row.from} {row.date} ))}
Subject From Date {emailData.slice(0, 3).map((row) => ( {row.subject} {row.from} {row.date} ))}
Subject From Date Kumo v1.0.0 released Visal In 5 seconds ago New Job Offer Cloudflare 10 minutes ago Daily Email Digest Cloudflare 1 hour ago
Subject From Date {emailData.map((row) => ( {row.subject} {row.from} {row.date} ))}

Subject From Date {emailData.map((row, index) => (
{row.subject} {row.tags && (
{row.tags.map((tag) => ( {tag} ))}
)}
{row.from} {row.date} ))}

Tabs.name: Tabs

tabs.description: Array of tab items to render

value.description: Controlled value. When set, component becomes controlled.

selectedValue.description: Default selected value for uncontrolled mode. Ignored when `value` is set.

activateOnFocus.description: When true, tabs are activated immediately upon receiving focus via arrow keys. When false (default), tabs receive focus but require Enter/Space to activate. Set to true for better keyboard UX in most cases.

className.description: Additional class name for the root element

listClassName.description: Additional class name for the tab list element

indicatorClassName.description: Additional class name for the indicator element

examples:
Segmented (default)

Underline

<Tabs
      variant="segmented"
      tabs={[
        { value: "tab1", label: "Tab 1" },
        { value: "tab2", label: "Tab 2" },
        { value: "tab3", label: "Tab 3" },
      ]}
      selectedValue="tab1"
    />

<Tabs
      variant="underline"
      tabs={[
        { value: "tab1", label: "Tab 1" },
        { value: "tab2", label: "Tab 2" },
        { value: "tab3", label: "Tab 3" },
      ]}
      selectedValue="tab1"
    />
Active tab: {activeTab}

<Tabs
      tabs={[
        { value: "overview", label: "Overview" },
        { value: "analytics", label: "Analytics" },
        { value: "reports", label: "Reports" },
        { value: "notifications", label: "Notifications" },
        { value: "settings", label: "Settings" },
        { value: "billing", label: "Billing" },
      ]}
      selectedValue="overview"
    />

<Tabs
      tabs={[
        {
          value: "tab1",
          label: "Regular Tab",
        },
        {
          value: "tab2",
          label: "Link Tab",
          render: (props) => <a {...props} href="#tab2" />,
        },
        {
          value: "tab3",
          label: "Another Link",
          render: (props) => <a {...props} href="#tab3" />,
        },
      ]}
      selectedValue="tab1"
    />

Text.name: Text

size.description: Text size (only applies to body/secondary/success/error variants)

bold.description: Whether to use bold font weight (only applies to body variants)

as.description: The element type to render as

Tooltip.name: Tooltip

descriptions.left: Tooltip appears to the left of the trigger
descriptions.right: Tooltip appears to the right of the trigger

content.description: Content to display in the tooltip

examples:
<TooltipProvider>
      <Tooltip content="Add new item" asChild>
        <Button shape="square" icon={PlusIcon} />
      </Tooltip>
    </TooltipProvider>

<TooltipProvider>
      <Tooltip content="Add" asChild>
        <Button shape="square" icon={PlusIcon} />
      </Tooltip>
    </TooltipProvider>

InputArea.name: InputArea
InputArea.description: Multi-line textarea input with Input variants and InputArea-specific dimensions

PageHeader.name: PageHeader

descriptions.relaxed: Relaxed spacing for more prominent headers

examples:
<PageHeader
      className="w-full"
      breadcrumbs={
        <Breadcrumbs>
          <Breadcrumbs.Link icon={<HouseIcon size={16} />} href="#">
            Workers & Pages
          </Breadcrumbs.Link>
          <Breadcrumbs.Separator />
          <Breadcrumbs.Current>cloudflare-dev-platform</Breadcrumbs.Current>
        </Breadcrumbs>
      }
      tabs={[
        { label: "Overview", value: "overview" },
        { label: "Metrics", value: "metrics" },
        { label: "Deployments", value: "deployments" },
        { label: "Bindings", value: "bindings" },
        { label: "Observability", value: "observability" },
        { label: "Settings", value: "settings" },
      ]}
      defaultTab="overview"
      onValueChange={(v) => console.log(v)}
    >
      <Button icon={<CodeIcon />} className="h-8">
        Edit code
      </Button>
      <Button icon={<GlobeIcon />} variant="primary" className="h-8">
        Visit
      </Button>
    </PageHeader>

<PageHeader
      breadcrumbs={
        <Breadcrumbs>
          <Breadcrumbs.Link href="#">Home</Breadcrumbs.Link>
          <Breadcrumbs.Separator />
          <Breadcrumbs.Current>Dashboard</Breadcrumbs.Current>
        </Breadcrumbs>
      }
    />

<PageHeader
      breadcrumbs={
        <Breadcrumbs>
          <Breadcrumbs.Link icon={<HouseIcon size={16} />} href="#">
            Home
          </Breadcrumbs.Link>
          <Breadcrumbs.Separator />
          <Breadcrumbs.Current icon={<GearIcon size={16} />}>
            Settings
          </Breadcrumbs.Current>
        </Breadcrumbs>
      }
    />

<PageHeader
      breadcrumbs={
        <Breadcrumbs>
          <Breadcrumbs.Link href="#">Home</Breadcrumbs.Link>
          <Breadcrumbs.Separator />
          <Breadcrumbs.Current>Settings</Breadcrumbs.Current>
        </Breadcrumbs>
      }
      tabs={[
        { label: "General", value: "general" },
        { label: "Security", value: "security" },
        { label: "Notifications", value: "notifications" },
      ]}
      defaultTab="general"
    />

<PageHeader
      breadcrumbs={
        <Breadcrumbs>
          <Breadcrumbs.Link href="#">Home</Breadcrumbs.Link>
          <Breadcrumbs.Separator />
          <Breadcrumbs.Link href="#">Projects</Breadcrumbs.Link>
          <Breadcrumbs.Separator />
          <Breadcrumbs.Current>My Project</Breadcrumbs.Current>
        </Breadcrumbs>
      }
      tabs={[
        { label: "Overview", value: "overview" },
        { label: "Settings", value: "settings" },
      ]}
      defaultTab="overview"
    >
      <Button variant="primary" size="base">
        Deploy
      </Button>
    </PageHeader>

<PageHeader
      breadcrumbs={
        <Breadcrumbs>
          <Breadcrumbs.Link href="#">Home</Breadcrumbs.Link>
          <Breadcrumbs.Separator />
          <Breadcrumbs.Link href="#">Products</Breadcrumbs.Link>
          <Breadcrumbs.Separator />
          <Breadcrumbs.Current>Page title</Breadcrumbs.Current>
        </Breadcrumbs>
      }
      title="Page title"
    />

<PageHeader
      breadcrumbs={
        <Breadcrumbs>
          <Breadcrumbs.Link href="#">Home</Breadcrumbs.Link>
          <Breadcrumbs.Separator />
          <Breadcrumbs.Link href="#">Products</Breadcrumbs.Link>
          <Breadcrumbs.Separator />
          <Breadcrumbs.Current>Page title</Breadcrumbs.Current>
        </Breadcrumbs>
      }
      title="Page title"
      description="Action-led, value-oriented description of what this page does. Optional second sentence with use cases or prerequisites."
    />

<PageHeader
      breadcrumbs={
        <Breadcrumbs>
          <Breadcrumbs.Link href="#">Home</Breadcrumbs.Link>
          <Breadcrumbs.Separator />
          <Breadcrumbs.Link href="#">Products</Breadcrumbs.Link>
          <Breadcrumbs.Separator />
          <Breadcrumbs.Current>Page title</Breadcrumbs.Current>
        </Breadcrumbs>
      }
      title="Page title"
      description="Action-led, value-oriented description of what this page does."
      tabs={[
        { label: "Overview", value: "overview" },
        { label: "Analytics", value: "analytics" },
        { label: "Settings", value: "settings" },
      ]}
      defaultTab="overview"
    >
      <Button variant="outline" size="sm">
        Export
      </Button>
      <Button variant="primary" size="sm" icon={<PlusIcon size={16} />}>
        New Item
      </Button>
    </PageHeader>

ResourceListPage.name: ResourceListPage
ResourceListPage.description: ResourceListPage - A layout component for resource list pages  Layouts are page-level components that provide consistent structure for common page patterns like resource lists, dashboards, and settings.
